page.title: 12LIFE STYLES(2)CALCOT,READING
page.content: Young people like to be the same as other young people.However,peer group pressure today is probably stronger than it has ever been. There is growing concern amongst Calcot/Tilehurst parents about 'glue- sniffing'.Secondary teachers keep a look out for young people who have a red mark beneath the nose.Though drugs and drug abuse is causing concern at a national level,Calcot and Tilehurst do not have a significant problem. The most talked about 'sub-culture' today is that of the 'punks'.These young people have spikey hair-styles, which stand straight up from their heads.Many older people are quite alarmed when meeting 'punks' in the street and often fear them. Special types of get together for dancing,called discos,are very popular with younger and older people.
